meanings.definition: A person who engages in barratry.
meanings.sent1: The barretor was known for causing trouble in the courtroom.
meanings.sent2: The judge warned the barretor to stop his disruptive behavior.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous barretor tried to stir up conflict for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her brother was a barretor, always stirring up arguments wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The barretor's actions were like a storm, causing chaos in the legal proceedings.

meanings.sent1: He decided to barretor against the rules of the court.
meanings.sent2: She barretors by constantly interrupting the proceedings.
meanings.sent3: The children barretor during playtime, pretending to argue over toys.
meanings.sent4: The politician barretors during debates to gain attention.
meanings.sent5: The students barretor in class, trying to outdo each other with their arguments.

meanings.sent1: The lawyer was accused of engaging in barretor.
meanings.sent2: Barretor is frowned upon in the legal profession.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit humorously portrayed the absurdity of barretor.
meanings.sent4: In the world of politics, barretor can be a common tactic.
meanings.sent5: The movie depicted the dark side of barretor, showing its destructive consequences.
